intro: Prestonia longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
